title: Meghan Markle rewore another of her old dresses
text:
From Cosmopolitan

Meghan Markle recycled a dress for the second time on tour in Africa yesterday.

The duchess rewore an old khaki striped maxi dress, first worn back in October 2018.

Meghan Markle is proving that good fashion can be timeless by wearing some of her favourite pieces on tour in Africa. Earlier this week she recycled a shirt dress first worn in Tonga, and now she's pulled out one of our favourite dresses again.

The duchess rewore her stunning khaki striped maxi dress, which she wore for the first time during her official visit to Australia last year. The £1,080 dress, by Aussie designer Martin Grant, was styled with black heels this time around, though - as opposed to bare feet for her beach visit last year.

Photo credit: Pool/Samir Hussein - Getty Images More

Photo credit: Pool/Samir Hussein - Getty Images More

During the engagement she opened up about bringing baby Archie on tour. A guest told Hello! Meghan said she he enjoyed the flight over. “They said it was the longest flight they have taken with Archie," the source revealed.

“She slept with one eye open – but he was very good."

And the cuteness keeps on coming. During a visit to Waves for Change, a charity in South Africa, Meghan and Harry were asked to share their strengths. When Meghan hesitated, someone suggested dancing (lol). "Not that,” she laughed, before explaining that “parenting” was her biggest strength, adding that the couple were “learning and developing”.

She then called Harry “the best dad”, to which he replied with a heartfelt “ahhh”, labelling Meghan as “the best mum”.

These two!

Follow Abbi on Instagram.

description: It's one of our favourite looks of hers
